thread.title: Travel, health, Brexit and mortgages - the new laws planned for the next two years

author: Jonathan Walker
title: Travel, health, Brexit and mortgages - the new laws planned for the next two years
text:
Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
The are the new laws that could be changing your life over the next two years. 
They were announced by the Government as part of the Queen’s Speech earlier this year - and here’s a complete run-down. 
First, an explanation about the jargon. These proposed laws are called “Bills” because they haven’t been approved by Parliament yet. 
If they are approved by Parliament, and receive Royal Assent from the Queen, then they become “Acts” instead. 
So here’s what’s planned: Automated and Electric Vehicles Bill An electric vehicle is re-charging at a point (Image: Getty Images Europe) 
Sets up a national network of charging points in garages and motorway service stations for electric cars, and ensures that insurance is available for self-driving cars. The aim is to help motor manufacturers by making their products more attractive to motorists. Space Industry Bill 
Makes it easier for businesses to launch spacecraft, from satellites to trips into space for tourists. High Speed 2 Phase 2A Bill 
Allows the extension of the high speed rail line from Birmingham to Crewe. Laws have already been approved which allow the line from London to Birmingham to be built. Smart Meter Bill 
Continues the process of putting smart gas and electricity meters in homes. Travel Protection Bill 
Gives more protection to travellers who book a holiday on the internet, for example if the travel company goes bust. Draft Tenants’ Fees Bill 
Bans landlords and estate agents from forcing tenants in private rented accommodation to pay letting fees. It also fixes the maximum security deposit that can be demanded at one month’s rent. Draft Domestic Violence and Abuse Bill 
Creates a Domestic Violence and Abuse Commissioner, creates a legal definition of domestic abuse and allows courts to hand down a tougher sentence if a child is affected by domestic abuse. Civil Liability Bill 
This Bill is designed to crack down on fraudulent whiplash claims and is expected to reduce motor insurance premiums by about £35 per year. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Courts Bill 
Ends direct cross examination of domestic violence victims by their alleged perpetrators in the family courts, allowing more victims to participate in trials without having to meet their alleged assailant face-to-face. Financial Guidance and Claims Bill 
Combines three financial advice bodies into one, ensuring that people across the UK are able to seek the help and advice they need to manage their finances. Goods Mortgage Bill 
Makes it easier to take out a mortgage on objects such as a car. Armed Forces Bill 
Enables limited flexible working in the armed forces. Read More
